relevant_findings.slit_lamp_exam: large central corneal ulcer with ring infiltrate and marked corneal edema with Descemetâ€™s folds

changes_over_time.vision: Deteriorated from 20/25 to light perception with projection, then to no light perception.
changes_over_time.corneal_inflammation: Initially significant, with mild improvement noted after treatment; then severe worsening leading to enucleation.

relevant_findings.slit_lamp_exam: large corneal ulcer with a paracentral ring infiltrate, meibomian gland inspissation, and inferior punctate corneal erosions

changes_over_time.vision: Deteriorated from 20/50 to counting fingers at 2 feet, then to light perception without projection.
changes_over_time.corneal_inflammation: Initial improvement after 1 week, followed by progressive deterioration and visual loss leading to enucleation.

relevant_findings.slit_lamp_exam: large central corneal ulcer with moderate stromal edema and moderate anterior chamber reaction

changes_over_time.vision: Deteriorated from 20/20 to counting fingers at 8 feet and light perception; ultimately progressed to enucleation.

relevant_findings.slit_lamp_exam: marked conjunctival injection, a well-circumscribed central corneal stromal opacity with surrounding ring-shaped infiltrate

changes_over_time.vision: Deteriorated from counting fingers to light perception without accurate projection, leading to enucleation.

relevant_findings.slit_lamp_exam: 5 mm central epithelial defect with surrounding ring infiltrate, radial keratoneuritis

changes_over_time.vision: Deteriorated from 20/20 to light perception without accurate projection associated with sequent complications.
